question:
Sometimes, the term “Pink Revolution” makes news in context with:
  1. Onion production
  2. Pharmaceuticals
  3. Prawn production
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Pink revolution has been used and propagated by the media in context with meat production. In the context of revolutions in India in the field of agriculture, “pink revolution” would refer to onion production/ pharmaceutical and prawn production. Meat production and tomato production are both referred to as “red revolution.” Some of the other revolutions are “black revolution” (petroleum production); “blue revolution” (fish production); “brown revolution” (leather/non-conventional/cocoa production); “grey revolution” (fertilizer production); “silver revolution” (egg/poultry production); “white revolution” (milk/dairy production, in India referred to as ‘Operation Flood,’ and “yellow revolution” (oilseeds production).
